meanings.definition: To focus or concentrate on a particular point or area.
meanings.sent1: She was focalizing on her homework, trying to finish it before dinner.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys focalizing on his favorite book every evening.
meanings.sent3: The cat was focalizing intently on the moving toy, ready to pounce.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a camera, focalizing sharply on the details of the painting.
meanings.sent5: Focalizing on the task at hand helped her complete it efficiently.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing something into focus or clarity.
meanings.sent1: The focalizing of the camera lens made the picture clear.
meanings.sent2: His focalizing of the telescope revealed the distant stars.
meanings.sent3: The sudden focalizing of the projector surprised the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her advice acted as a focalizing lens, bringing clarity to the situation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation was like a focalizing beam of light in the confusion.

meanings.definition: The process of directing attention or emphasis towards a specific point or goal.
meanings.sent1: The focalizing of resources on the project ensured its success.
meanings.sent2: Her focalizing on the main idea helped her write a clear essay.
meanings.sent3: The team's focalizing on the end goal motivated them to work harder.
meanings.sent4: The leader's speech acted as a focalizing force, uniting the team.
meanings.sent5: The coach's guidance was like a focalizing compass, pointing them towards victory.
